problem: David decides to run 5 sprints 5 times a week.  He runs 43 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
William decides to run 2 sprints 5 times a week.  He runs 88 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
Michael decides to run 3 sprints 7 times a week.  He runs 96 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
Charles decides to run 2 sprints 3 times a week.  He runs 27 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
solution:
He sprints 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 times
So he runs 6*27=<<6*27=162>>162 meters
#### 162

Margaret wants to buy a $937.00 pair of shoes and a matching belt that is $53.00.  Her part-time job pays her $6.00 an hour.  How many hours will she have to work before she can make her purchase?
solution:
She wants to buy a pair of shoes for $937.00 and a belt for $53.00 for a total of 937+53 = $<<937+53=990>>990.00
Her purchase will total $990.00 and she makes $6.00 at her part-time job so she'll have to work 990/6 = <<990/6=165>>165 hours
#### 165

problem: A football team has 196 members.  There are twice as many players on the offense as there is on the defense. There is half the number of players on the special teams as there is on the defense.  How many players are on the defense?
solution:
Let x represent the number of players on the defense
Offense:2x
Special Teams:(1/2)x
Total:x+2x+(1/2)x=196
(7/2)x=196
x=196(2/7)=56 players
#### 56

problem: Joseph injured his back and needs to go to physical therapy.  He went to physical therapy for 6 weeks.  Each week he went twice for 3 hours at a time.  If the sessions cost $149 per hour how much did the physical therapy cost?
solution:
Each week he did 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours of physical therapy
So it cost 6*149=$<<6*149=894>>894 per week
This means he spent 894*6=$<<894*6=5364>>5364

problem: William saw 99 birds in their backyard and threw a stone at them, scaring away 1/3 of that number. A few minutes later, 68 more birds joined the fearless birds. How many birds are now in the backyard?
solution:
The total number of birds scared away after he threw the stone at them is 1/3 * 99 = <<1/3*99=33>>33 birds.
The total number of birds remaining is 99 - 33 = <<99-33=66>>66 birds.
If 68 more birds joined, the total number of birds in the backyard will become 66 + 68 = <<66+68=134>>134 birds.
#### 134

problem: My mom went to a gardening shop. She bought a set of pots for $74 and a sack of garden soil for $80. At checkout, she used a coupon for $27 off. How much money did my mom spend at the gardening shop?

problem: From her science class study, Jennifer learned that each whale in the sea has 5 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*5 = <<3*5=15>>15 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*15 = <<10*15=150>>150 gallons of blood.
#### 150

10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*246 = <<10*246=2460>>2460 gallons of blood.
#### 2460

problem: From her science class study, Jennifer learned that each whale in the sea has 36 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*108 = <<10*108=1080>>1080 gallons of blood.
#### 1080

problem: From her science class study, Susan learned that each whale in the sea has 16 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*16 = <<3*16=48>>48 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*48 = <<10*48=480>>480 gallons of blood.
#### 480

problem: Charles spends 6 hours watching TV and then decides to go to bed and reads for half as long.  He does this 7 times a week.  How many hours does he spend on TV and reading in 2 weeks?
solution:
He reads for 6/2=<<6/2=3>>3 hour a night
So he spends 6+3=<<6+3=9>>9 hours on these activities
That means he spends 9*7=<<9*7=63>>63 hours a week on them
So in 2 weeks, he spends 63*2=<<63*2=126>>126 hours on these activities
#### 126

So he spends 4+2=<<4+2=6>>6 hours on these activities
That means he spends 6*4=<<6*4=24>>24 hours a week on them
So in 21 weeks, he spends 24*21=<<24*21=504>>504 hours on these activities
#### 504
